cache.serverCache: Redis-based server cache that stores API responses and database queries to improve performance and reduce server load.
cache.clientCache: Browser memory cache that stores API responses locally to reduce network requests and improve page load times.
cache.hitRatio: Percentage of requests served from cache instead of the database. Higher is better.
cache.keys: Number of unique items currently stored in the Redis cache.
cache.memory: Amount of memory used by the Redis cache server.
cache.items: Number of API responses stored in the browser's memory cache.
cache.size: Maximum number of items that can be stored in the client cache before older items are removed.
